page.title: 12Major T. Trollope-Bellew
page.content: {Major Thomas Trollope -Bellew } has recently retired as a County Councillor- a position which has consumed much of his time over recent years through offices in Taunton (County Hall) and Dulverton (Exmoor House). Crowcombe Court, Beadons and The Cottage have all been home for The Major who now lives in a recently constructed property 'The Bungalow'. { The family estate extends to some {1600 acres,}though some is in Lincolnshire and includes farming, woodland and hills. The family name Carew has its roots in Pembrokeshire where there is a {Carew Castle.}The name has no recent connection with the Carew name linked with the raised ship The Mary Rose. The Major now spends time farming, growing roses and watching cricket.
